column4: there's something completely wrong with Nautilus. I caught it using 1gb of ram. Is this a bug?
using search function or just sitting there?
just sitting there doing nothing. I had a wm-window open, but that's it.
did you check ps ax for other things that may be running?
I've caught it hanging several times today too, for no apparent reason.
ps ax?
what should I look for? I had to restart nautilus before, because it made my system practically stand still.
I don't know what to look for.
in a terminal type 'top' and check the top of the list.
right now python is using the most CPU and memory
yes.. I was just wondering if there was a known problem with Nautilus, seeing it used so much ram.
not sure, are all of you gnome updates installed?
yes.
yes.
you have the 'proposed' branch enabled?
yes..
just a friendly suggestion, disable that, its can't ever be a good thing unless your actually debugging those programs.
alright.
you probably installed a proposed update that isn't fully implemented yet.
I know folks that are all in your face, and they only market well when they get in your face, you buy 9/10 times.
